ContactInfo.longDescription: This object shall contain contact information for an individual or organization responsible for this resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

ContactName.longDescription: This property shall contain the name of a person or organization to contact for information about this resource.

EmailAddress.longDescription: This property shall contain the email address for a person or organization to contact for information about this resource.

PhoneNumber.longDescription: This property shall contain the phone number for a person or organization to contact for information about this resource.

enumDeprecated.NSID: This value has been deprecated due to its non-uniqueness and `NGUID` should be used.

enumDescriptions.FC_WWN: The Fibre Channel (FC) World Wide Name (WWN).
enumDescriptions.GCXLID: The globally unique CXL logical device identifier (GCXLID).
enumDescriptions.MACAddress: The media access control address (MAC address).

enumLongDescriptions.EUI: This durable name shall contain the hexadecimal representation of the IEEE-defined 64-bit Extended Unique Identifier (EUI), as defined in the IEEE's Guidelines for 64-bit Global Identifier (EUI-64) Specification.  The DurableName property shall follow the regular expression pattern '^([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}[:-]){7}([0-9A-Fa-f]{2})$', where the most significant octet is first.
enumLongDescriptions.FC_WWN: This durable name shall contain a hexadecimal representation of the World-Wide Name (WWN) format, as defined in the T11 Fibre Channel Physical and Signaling Interface Specification.  The DurableName property shall follow the regular expression pattern '^([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}[:-]){7}([0-9A-Fa-f]{2})$', where the most significant octet is first.
enumLongDescriptions.GCXLID: This durable name shall be in the globally unique CXL logical device identifier (GCXLID).  The DurableName property shall follow the regular expression pattern '^([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}-){7}[0-9A-Fa-f]{2}:([0-9A-Fa-f]{4})$', where the first eight hyphen-delimited octets contain the PCIe serial number, where the most significant octet is first, and the remaining 16-bit field contains the CXL Logical Device Identifier, where the most significant byte first.
enumLongDescriptions.MACAddress: This durable name shall be a media access control address (MAC address), which is a unique identifier assigned to a network interface controller (NIC) for use as a network address.  This value should not be used if a more specific type of identifier is available.  The DurableName property shall follow the regular expression pattern '^([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}[:-]){5}([0-9A-Fa-f]{2})$', where the most significant octet is first.
enumLongDescriptions.NAA: This durable name shall contain a hexadecimal representation of the Name Address Authority structure, as defined in the T11 Fibre Channel - Framing and Signaling - 3 (FC-FS-3) specification.  The DurableName property shall follow the regular expression pattern '^(([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}){8}){1,2}$', where the most significant octet is first.
enumLongDescriptions.NGUID: This durable name shall be in the Namespace Globally Unique Identifier (NGUID), as defined in the NVN Express Specification.  The DurableName property shall follow the regular expression pattern '^([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}){16}$', where the most significant octet is first.
enumLongDescriptions.NQN: This durable name shall be in the NVMe Qualified Name (NQN) format, as defined in the NVN Express over Fabric Specification.
enumLongDescriptions.NSID: This durable name shall be in the NVM Namespace Identifier (NSID) format, as defined in the NVN Express Specification.
enumLongDescriptions.UUID: This durable name shall contain the hexadecimal representation of the UUID, as defined by RFC4122.  The DurableName property shall follow the regular expression pattern '([0-9a-fA-F]{8}-[0-9a-fA-F]{4}-[0-9a-fA-F]{4}-[0-9a-fA-F]{4}-[0-9a-fA-F]{12})'.
enumLongDescriptions.iQN: This durable name shall be in the iSCSI Qualified Name (iQN) format, as defined in RFC3720 and RFC3721.

Identifier.description: Any additional identifiers for a resource.
Identifier.longDescription: This type shall contain any additional identifiers for a resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

DurableName.description: The world-wide, persistent name of the resource.
DurableName.longDescription: This property shall contain the world-wide unique identifier for the resource.  The string shall be in the Identifier.DurableNameFormat property value format.

DurableNameFormat.description: The format of the durable name property.
DurableNameFormat.longDescription: This property shall represent the format of the DurableName property.

Location.longDescription: This type shall describe the location of a resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AltitudeMeters.description: The altitude of the resource in meters.
AltitudeMeters.longDescription: This property shall contain the altitude of the resource, in meters units, defined as the elevation above sea level.

Contacts.longDescription: This property shall contain an array of contact information for an individual or organization responsible for this resource.

Info.deprecated: This property has been deprecated in favor of the PostalAddress, Placement, and PartLocation properties.
Info.longDescription: This property shall represent the location of the resource.

InfoFormat.deprecated: This property has been deprecated in favor of the PostalAddress, Placement, and PartLocation properties.
InfoFormat.description: The format of the Info property.
InfoFormat.longDescription: This property shall represent the Info property format.

Latitude.longDescription: This property shall contain the latitude of the resource specified in degrees using a decimal format and not minutes or seconds.

Longitude.description: The longitude of the resource in degrees.
Longitude.longDescription: This property shall contain the longitude of the resource specified in degrees using a decimal format and not minutes or seconds.

Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the OEM extensions.  All values for properties contained in this object shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.

PartLocation.description: The part location for a resource within an enclosure.
PartLocation.longDescription: This property shall contain the part location for a resource within an enclosure.  This representation shall indicate the location of a part within a location specified by the Placement property.

Placement.description: A place within the addressed location.
Placement.longDescription: This property shall contain a place within the addressed location.

PostalAddress.description: The postal address of the addressed resource.
PostalAddress.longDescription: This property shall contain a postal address of the resource.

LocationType.description: The types of locations for a part within an enclosure.

enumLongDescriptions.Backplane: This value shall indicate the part is a backplane in an enclosure.
enumLongDescriptions.Bay: This value shall indicate the part is located in a bay.
enumLongDescriptions.Connector: This value shall indicate the part is located in a connector or port.
enumLongDescriptions.Embedded: This value shall indicate the part is embedded or otherwise permanently incorporated into a larger part or device.  This value shall not be used for parts that can be removed by a user or are considered field-replaceable.
enumLongDescriptions.Slot: This value shall indicate the part is located in a slot.
enumLongDescriptions.Socket: This value shall indicate the part is located in a socket.

LocationType.longDescription: This enumeration shall list the types of locations for a part within an enclosure.

Orientation.description: The orientations for the ordering of the part location ordinal value.

enumDescriptions.BackToFront: The ordering for the LocationOrdinalValue is back to front.
enumDescriptions.BottomToTop: The ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is bottom to top.
enumDescriptions.FrontToBack: The ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is front to back.
enumDescriptions.LeftToRight: The ordering for the LocationOrdinalValue is left to right.
enumDescriptions.RightToLeft: The ordering for the LocationOrdinalValue is right to left.
enumDescriptions.TopToBottom: The ordering for the LocationOrdinalValue is top to bottom.

enumLongDescriptions.BackToFront: This value shall indicate the ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is back to front.
enumLongDescriptions.BottomToTop: This value shall indicate the ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is bottom to top.
enumLongDescriptions.FrontToBack: This value shall indicate the ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is front to back.
enumLongDescriptions.LeftToRight: This value shall indicate the ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is left to right.
enumLongDescriptions.RightToLeft: This value shall indicate the ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is right to left.
enumLongDescriptions.TopToBottom: This value shall indicate the ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is top to bottom.

Orientation.longDescription: This enumeration shall list the orientations for the ordering of the LocationOrdinalValue property.

PartLocation.description: The part location for a resource within an enclosure.
PartLocation.longDescription: This type shall describe a location for a resource within an enclosure.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

LocationOrdinalValue.description: The number that represents the location of the part.  For example, if LocationType is `Slot` and this unit is in slot 2, the LocationOrdinalValue is `2`.
LocationOrdinalValue.longDescription: This property shall contain the number that represents the location of the part based on the LocationType.  LocationOrdinalValue shall be measured based on the Orientation value starting with `0`.

LocationType.description: The type of location of the part.
LocationType.longDescription: This property shall contain the type of location of the part.

Orientation.description: The orientation for the ordering of the slot enumeration used by the LocationOrdinalValue property.
Orientation.longDescription: This property shall contain the orientation for the ordering used by the LocationOrdinalValue property.

Reference.description: The reference point for the part location.  Provides guidance about the general location of the part.
Reference.longDescription: This property shall contain the general location within the unit of the part.

ServiceLabel.description: The label of the part location, such as a silk-screened name or a printed label.
ServiceLabel.longDescription: This property shall contain the label assigned for service at the part location.

Placement.description: The placement within the addressed location.
Placement.longDescription: The value shall describe a location within a resource.  Examples include a shelf in a rack.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AdditionalInfo.description: Area designation or other additional info.
AdditionalInfo.longDescription: This property shall contain additional information, such as Tile, Column (Post), Wall, or other designation that describes a location that cannot be conveyed with other properties defined for the Placement object.

Rack.description: The name of a rack location within a row.
Rack.longDescription: This property shall contain the name of the rack within a row.

RackOffset.description: The vertical location of the item, in terms of RackOffsetUnits.
RackOffset.longDescription: The vertical location of the item in the rack.  Rack offset units shall be measured from bottom to top, starting with 0.

RackOffsetUnits.description: The type of rack units in use.
RackOffsetUnits.longDescription: This property shall contain a RackUnit enumeration literal that indicates the type of rack units in use.

Row.longDescription: This property shall contain the name of the row.

PostalAddress.description: The postal address for a resource.
PostalAddress.longDescription: Instances shall describe a postal address for a resource.  For more information, see RFC5139.  Depending on use, the instance can represent a past, current, or future location.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AdditionalCode.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the ADDCODE field.

AdditionalInfo.description: The room designation or other additional information.
AdditionalInfo.longDescription: The value shall conform to the requirements of the LOC field as defined in RFC5139.  Provides additional information.

Building.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the BLD field.  Names the building.

City.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the A3 field.  Names a city, township, or shi (JP).

Community.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the PCN field.  A postal community name.

Country.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the Country field.

District.description: A county, parish, gun (JP), or district (IN).
District.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the A2 field.  Names a county, parish, gun (JP), or district (IN).

Division.description: City division, borough, city district, ward, or chou (JP).
Division.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the A4 field.  Names a city division, borough, city district, ward, or chou (JP).

Floor.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the FLR field.  Provides a floor designation.

GPSCoords.deprecated: This property has been deprecated in favor of the Longitude and Latitude properties.
GPSCoords.description: The GPS coordinates of the part.
GPSCoords.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the ADDCODE field.  Shall contain the GPS coordinates of the location.  If furnished, expressed in the '[-][nn]n.nnnnnn, [-][nn]n.nnnnn' format.  For example, two comma-separated positive or negative numbers with six decimal places of precision.

HouseNumber.description: The numeric portion of house number.
HouseNumber.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the HNO field.  The numeric portion of the house number.

HouseNumberSuffix.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the HNS field.  Provides a suffix to a house number, (F, B, or 1/2).

Landmark.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the LMK field.  Identifies a landmark or vanity address.

LeadingStreetDirection.longDescription: The value shall conform to the requirements of the PRD field as defined in RFC5139.  Names a leading street direction, (N, W, or SE).

Location.deprecated: This property has been deprecated in favor of the AdditionalInfo property.
Location.description: The room designation or other additional information.
Location.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the LOC field.  Provides additional information.

Name.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the NAM field.  Names the occupant.

Neighborhood.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the A5 field.  Names a neighborhood or block.

POBox.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the POBOX field.  A post office box (PO box).

PlaceType.description: The description of the type of place that is addressed.
PlaceType.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the PLC field.  Examples include office and residence.

PostalCode.description: The postal code or zip code.
PostalCode.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the PC field.  A postal code (or zip code).

Road.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the RD field.  Designates a primary road or street.

RoadBranch.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the RDBR field.  Shall contain a post office box (PO box) road branch.

RoadPostModifier.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the POM field.  For example, Extended.

RoadPreModifier.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the PRM field.  For example, Old or New.

RoadSection.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the RDSEC field.  A road section.

RoadSubBranch.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the RDSUBBR field.

Room.description: The name or number of the room.
Room.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the ROOM field.  A name or number of a room to locate the resource within the unit.

Seat.description: The seat, such as the desk, cubicle, or workstation.
Seat.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the SEAT field.  A name or number of a seat, such as the desk, cubicle, or workstation.

Street.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the A6 field.  Names a street.

StreetSuffix.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the STS field.  Names a street suffix.

Territory.description: A top-level subdivision within a country.
Territory.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the A1 field when it names a territory, state, region, province, or prefecture within a country.

TrailingStreetSuffix.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the POD field.  Names a trailing street suffix.

Unit.description: The name or number of the apartment unit or suite.
Unit.longDescription: The value shall conform to the RFC5139-defined requirements of the UNIT field.  The name or number of a unit, such as the apartment or suite, to locate the resource.

RackUnits.description: The type of rack unit in use.

enumDescriptions.EIA_310: A rack unit that is equal to 1.75 in (44.45 mm).
enumDescriptions.OpenU: A rack unit that is equal to 48 mm (1.89 in).

enumLongDescriptions.EIA_310: Rack units shall conform to the EIA-310 standard.
enumLongDescriptions.OpenU: Rack units shall be specified in terms of the Open Compute Open Rack Specification.

RackUnits.longDescription: Enumeration literals shall name the type of rack unit in use.

Reference.description: The reference areas for the location of the part within an enclosure.

enumDescriptions.Bottom: The part is in the bottom of the unit.
enumDescriptions.Front: The part is in the front of the unit.
enumDescriptions.Left: The part is on the left side of of the unit.
enumDescriptions.Middle: The part is in the middle of the unit.
enumDescriptions.Rear: The part is in the rear of the unit.
enumDescriptions.Right: The part is on the right side of the unit.
enumDescriptions.Top: The part is in the top of the unit.

enumLongDescriptions.Bottom: This value shall indicate the part is in the bottom of the unit.
enumLongDescriptions.Front: This value shall indicate the part is in the front of the unit.
enumLongDescriptions.Left: This value shall indicate the part is on the left side of of the unit.
enumLongDescriptions.Middle: This value shall indicate the part is in the middle of the unit.
enumLongDescriptions.Rear: This value shall indicate the part is in the rear of the unit.
enumLongDescriptions.Right: This value shall indicate the part is on the right side of the unit.
enumLongDescriptions.Top: This value shall indicate the part is in the top of the unit.

Reference.longDescription: This enumeration shall list the reference areas for the location of the part within an enclosure.

ReferenceableMember.description: The base type for addressable members of an array.
ReferenceableMember.longDescription: References array members by using the value returned in the @odata.id property, which can be a dereferenceable URL.  The @odata.id of this entity shall contain the location of this element within an item.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

MemberId.description: The unique identifier for the member within an array.
MemberId.longDescription: This property shall contain the unique identifier for this member within an array.  For services supporting Redfish v1.6 or higher, this value shall contain the zero-based array index.

Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the OEM extensions.  All values for properties that this object contains shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.

Resource.description: The base type for resources and members that can be linked to.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the OEM extensions.  All values for properties that this object contains shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the OEM extensions.  All values for properties contained in this object shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.

title: #Resource.v1_15_0
